intro: Secamone pulchra subsp. pulchra, commonly known as the African violet, is a striking ornamental plant native to eastern Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its velvety, waxy leaves and showy, tubular flowers that range in color from purple to white. The plant typically grows as a compact shrub, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters, and thrives in humid, well-drained conditions. Its foliage is evergreen, and it is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and as a houseplant.
